name: Arts and Industry Exhibition in Christiania (Oslo)
obverse: A woman representing Norway sits between two boys who personify the arts and industry respectively. To the left is a palette with brushes and a bust. To the right is a hammer, anvil, and other industrial instruments.
obverse_inscriptions: KUNSTENS ID OG HAANDENS VERK GJÖRE NORGE FRI OG STÆRK
reverse: The center pavilion of the exhibition building.
reverse_inscriptions: ERINDRING FRA INDUSTRI OG KUNST-UDSTILLINGEN I CHRISTIANIA
description: This medal was made to commemorate the Arts and Industry Exhibition held in Oslo, Norway (then known as 'Christiania') in 1883.
